p: Most viral proteins are located inside the lipid envelope, while only HA, NA (in the molar relation about 10:1; Mitnaul et al. 2000) and M2 proteins, which are built into the virion envelope and present antigenic determinants, are available for immune antibodies (Kosik and Yewdell 2019). HA and NA molecules are highly glycosylated proteins, which give them functional activity and provide for immune evasion by shielding antigenic determinants (Kim et al. 2018; York, Stevens and Alymova 2019).
